paper_title.en: A new method for the measurement of sedimentation potential: rotating column method

description.en: A new method has been developed for the measurement of the sedimentation potential. It was found that by rotating the: sedimentation column upside down, the sedimentation potential can be measured with high accuracy without causing errors due to the drifts and/or the asymmetry of the measuring electrodes. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: COLLOIDS AND SURFACES A-PHYSICOCHEMICAL AND ENGINEERING ASPECTS

paper_title.en: Direct observation of the formation of loop-like agglomerates of spindle-type hematite particles due to weak magnetic interactions

description.en: Aqueous dispersions of coarse spindle-like hematite particles were studied under an optical microscope. In the aqueous dispersions of the hematite particles, the formation of loop-like agglomerates was visually observed. It is suggested that the loop-like agglomerates were brought about by magnetic interactions between the particles.

publication_name.en: COLLOIDS AND SURFACES A-PHYSICOCHEMICAL AND ENGINEERING ASPECTS

paper_title.en: Investigation of the Magnetization Reversal Mode for individual ellipsoidal Single-domain Particles
Measurement of thermal Switching of the Magnetization of Single Domain Particles
Measurement of the dynamics of the magnetization reversal in individual single-domain ferromagnetic particles

description.en: We have measured the spontaneous thermal switching of the magnetization of individual single-domain ellipsoidal ferromagnetic γ-Fe2O3 particles. At room temperature, and in applied fields close to coercivity, the statistics of the reversal cannot be described by activation over a single-energy barrier as originally proposed by Néel. We suggest the dynamics of reversal occurs via a complex path in configuration space, and a complex theoretical approach is required to provide a correct description of thermally activated magnetization reversal even in single-domain ferromagnetic particles. © 1994 The American Physical Society.

paper_title.ja: 統一試料ラテックスによるゼータ電位及び安定性の共同測定
paper_title.en: Collaborative Study of Zeta-potential and Stability of Latex Suspensions

description.ja:
Simultaneous measurements of zeta (ζ) -potential and critical flocculation concentration (c.f.c.) s for two standard latex suspensions (Sample-A : Styrene/Nass copolymer latices, Sample-B : Amphoteric latices) were carried out so as to assess the reliability of each of these measurement techniques and find means for their improvement.
The ζ-potential measurements were carried out at nine laboratories using different electrophoretic apparatus, which included the Rank Brother M-2, PEN KEM-501, PEN KEM-3000 and Malvern Zetasizer-F. The data from all the laboratories showed fair agreement. Elevated potential supply was found to increase the slope of the ζ vs. pH curve near the isoelectric point of sample-B.
The c.f.cs. of KNO3, Mg (NO3) 2 and La (NO3) 3 for sample-A, were determined simultaneously by a static method and the results compared with those determined by a kinetic method and dynamic light scattering (L.S.). The order of the magnitude of the values of c.f.c. can be expressed as follows : static method < L.S. technique < kinetic method. Furthermore, it was found that in determining the c.f.c., the solid concentration in the medium was important factor.
description.en:
Simultaneous measurements of zeta (ζ) -potential and critical flocculation concentration (c.f.c.) s for two standard latex suspensions (Sample-A : Styrene/Nass copolymer latices, Sample-B : Amphoteric latices) were carried out so as to assess the reliability of each of these measurement techniques and find means for their improvement.
The ζ-potential measurements were carried out at nine laboratories using different electrophoretic apparatus, which included the Rank Brother M-2, PEN KEM-501, PEN KEM-3000 and Malvern Zetasizer-F. The data from all the laboratories showed fair agreement. Elevated potential supply was found to increase the slope of the ζ vs. pH curve near the isoelectric point of sample-B.
The c.f.cs. of KNO3, Mg (NO3) 2 and La (NO3) 3 for sample-A, were determined simultaneously by a static method and the results compared with those determined by a kinetic method and dynamic light scattering (L.S.). The order of the magnitude of the values of c.f.c. can be expressed as follows : static method < L.S. technique < kinetic method. Furthermore, it was found that in determining the c.f.c., the solid concentration in the medium was important factor.
